nouns.definition: a sweet baked dish made from flour, sugar, eggs, and other ingredients, usually in a round or square shape
example: I love to bake cakes.
I'll bring the cake to the party.

nouns.definition: a large body of water surrounded by land
example: I went swimming in the lake.
The lake is frozen over this time of year.

nouns.definition: a dark area on a surface caused by an object blocking light
example: The shadow of the tree fell across the lawn.
The shadow of the building was cast on the ground.

nouns.definition: a large area of land covered in trees
example: The forest is home to many different animals.
The forest was destroyed by a forest fire.

verbs.definition: to form a mental picture of something that is not present
example: I imagined what it would be like to live in a castle.
She imagined herself winning the lottery.

verbs.definition: to read something carefully and attentively
example: I perused the book before I bought it.
She perused the internet for information about the latest news.

verbs.definition: to say something funny
example: I joked about the situation to lighten the mood.
The comedian joked about his own weight.

verbs.definition: to be or have being
example: The universe exists.
God exists, or so they say.
I moved far, far away from my hometown.
I want to go to a place far, far away.
I took a deep breath and jumped into the water.
She took a deep breath before giving her speech.
I made a mistake on my math test.
She made a mistake by trusting him.

nouns.definition: a building for human habitation, typically with a roof and walls
example: The house is on fire.
We went to the house.

nouns.definition: a group of people who are related to each other by blood, marriage, or adoption
example: My family is very large.
We had dinner with my family.

nouns.definition: an intoxicating drink
example: I like to drink alcohol.
The alcohol made me drunk.

verbs.definition: make a mark on a surface to indicate approval, agreement, or ownership
example: I signed the contract.
She signed her name.

verbs.definition: recall knowledge of or have in mind something previously perceived, experienced, or learned
example: I remember what you said.
She remembered her childhood.

verbs.definition: not drunk
example: I was sober when I drove home.
He was sober enough to drive.

idioms.definition: contribute money or other resources to a common fund or cause
example: We all chipped in to buy a new couch.
She chipped in some money for the pizza.

idioms.definition: something that is useless or no longer effective
example: The old car is a dead tooth.
The old computer is a dead tooth.

idioms.definition: a person who no longer feels alive or who has lost all joy in life
example: He's like a living ghost since his wife died.
She's a living ghost since she lost her job.

nouns.definition: a female parent
example: I love my mother very much
My mother is a good person.

nouns.definition: a refrigerator
example: My mother put the chicken in the icebox.
The icebox was empty.

nouns.definition: a domesticated fowl, Gallus gallus domesticus, that is raised for its meat and eggs.
example: We ate fried chicken for dinner.
The chicken laid an egg.

nouns.definition: a flat, usually round, dish used for serving or eating food
example: We used plates for dinner.
The plate was made of glass.

nouns.definition: a bladed implement used for cutting
example: I cut the chicken with a knife.
The knife was sharp.

nouns.definition: a handheld implement with two or more prongs, used for eating
example: We used forks to eat the chicken.
The fork was metal.

nouns.definition: at the end of the available time
example: We decided to go to the movies at the last minute.
The plane left at the last minute.

nouns.definition: the food eaten at one time
example: We had a delicious meal at the restaurant.
The meal was healthy.

nouns.definition: to understand something or find a solution to a problem
example: I can't figure out how to fix this computer.
I finally figured out how to solve the puzzle.

nouns.definition: to visit a restaurant or other place to eat
example: We went to eat at the new Italian restaurant.
The restaurant was crowded.

nouns.definition: a piece of cloth hung over a window to keep out the light or provide privacy
example: We bought some new curtains for the living room.
The curtains were blue.

verbs.definition: to put things together in a container
example: I packed my suitcase for the trip.
The movers packed up all the furniture.

verbs.definition: to make a phone call to someone
example: I called my mother to wish her a happy birthday.
The phone rang and I answered it.

verbs.definition: to stop talking on the phone
example: I hung up the phone and went to bed.
The phone rang and I hung up.

verbs.definition: to hope for something
example: I wish I had more money.
I wish I could go on vacation.

verbs.definition: to express something in words
example: I said hello to my mother.
The teacher said the answer was 42.

verbs.definition: to make something or oneself curve
example: I bent the paper into a square.
The tree bent in the wind.

verbs.definition: to pay attention to sounds
example: I listened to the birds singing.
The teacher listened to the students answer.

verbs.definition: to make something unable to be opened
example: I closed the door behind me.
The door closed automatically.

verbs.definition: to take something from someone with the intention of returning it
example: I borrowed my friend's car.
The library borrows books from other libraries.

verbs.definition: to move quickly by taking steps
example: I ran to the store to buy some milk.
The dog ran after the ball.

verbs.definition: to rest with one's weight on one's buttocks
example: I sat down on the couch.
The cat sat on the windowsill.

verbs.definition: to operate a vehicle
example: I drove my car to work.
The bus driver drove

nouns.definition: a city in the northeastern United States.
example: I'm going to New York for vacation.
She's from New York.

nouns.definition: a building that provides lodging and meals for travelers.
example: I stayed at a hotel when I was in Miami.
The hotel had a pool and a restaurant.

nouns.definition: a publication containing articles, stories, pictures, etc., usually issued regularly.
example: I read an article in a magazine about the history of the city.
I bought a magazine to read on the plane.

nouns.definition: the hard part at the end of a finger or toe.
example: I broke my nail when I hit it with a hammer.
She painted her nails red.

nouns.definition: the natural satellite of the Earth.
example: The moon is the only natural satellite of the Earth.
I saw the moon last night.

verbs.definition: to make a bell-like sound.
example: The phone rang.
The doorbell rang.

verbs.definition: to remove all moisture from something.
example: I dried the dishes.
I dried my hair.

verbs.definition: to remain in a place in order to receive something or for something to happen.
example: I waited for the bus.
I waited for the movie to start.

idioms.definition: the day with the highest temperature on record.
example: It was the hottest day in history.
The hottest day of the year.
